title: 20-Year-Old Ex-Con Charged In Critical Wounding Of 2-Year-Old Lansing Girl
content:
LANSING (AP) – A 20-year-old ex-con has appeared in court on accusations that he accidentally shot and critically wounded a 2-year-old Lansing girl.
Jaylen L. Briggs of Lansing was arraigned Monday on charges of carelessly firing a gun causing injury, possession of a firearm by a convicted felon, carrying a concealed weapon and possessing a firearm while committing a felony.
Lansing District Court Magistrate Laura Millmore set his bond at $15,000 and scheduled his next court appearance May 1.
Court records don’t show a lawyer for Briggs.
Police say the girl was shot Friday evening. They say she was conscious when police arrived and was in critical but stable condition at a hospital.
